23   | #include <sys/nearptr.h>
24   | #include <crt0.h>
25   | #endif

27   | #ifdef __MSC__
28   | #include <memory.h>
29   | #else
30   | #include <mem.h>

33   | /* Dynamic memory handling shell */
34   | /*
35   | #include <mshell.h>

38   | /*----- Local variables -----*/
39   | static int startrow;
40   | static int startcol;
41   | 
42   | /* GLOBAL VARIABLES
43   | -------------------*/
44   | /* VP vptr; */                      /* Pointer to first byte in video RAM */
45   | char   *start_screen = NULL;   /* Pointer to save DOS screen         */
46   | WINDOW *top_window   = NULL;   /* Pointer to top window              */
47   | WINDOW *start_window = NULL;   /* Start window of double linked list */
48   | WINDOW *last_window  = NULL;   /* Last window of double linked list  */
49   | 
50   | unsigned int non_ibm = 0x0001;
51   | 
52   | extern SCREEN _cursvar;
53   | 
54   | /*--------------------------
55   |   Local function prototypes
56   | ----------------------------*/
57   | static WINDOW *add_wn_list(WINDOW *w);
58   | static WINDOW *del_wn_list(WINDOW *w);
59   | static void level_wnds(WINDOW *startw);
60   | 
61   | 
62   | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
63   |     FUNCTION: wn_closeall()
64   |      PURPOSE: Close all opened windows.
65   |       SYNTAX: void wn_closeall(void);
66   |  DESCRIPTION: Goes through the linked window list and closes all windows
67   |               in this list.
68   |      RETURNS: Always returns TRUE
69   |      HISTORY: 920224 V0.1
70   | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
71   | int wn_closeall()
72   | {
73   |   WINDOW *w, *nextw;
74   | 
75   |   /*------------------
76   |     Close all windows
77   |   --------------------*/
78   |   if (start_window != NULL) {
79   |     w = start_window;
80   |     while (w) {
81   |       nextw = w->next;
82   |       wn_close(w);
83   |       w = nextw;
84   |     }
85   |   }
86   |   return(TRUE);
87   | }
88   | 
89   | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
90   |     FUNCTION: wn_update()
91   |      PURPOSE: window update
92   |       SYNTAX: int wn_update(void);
93   |  DESCRIPTION: Update entire screen by redrawing all window's from the window
94   |               list in the order as they are in this list on a virtual screen,
95   |               after which this virtual screen will be copied to the physical
96   |               screen.
97   |      RETURNS: TRUE if all OK, FALSE if not
98   |      HISTORY: 920212 V0.1
99   |               920919 V0.2 Now also fills virtual window with _desktop_att
100  |               920920 V0.3 Hidden windows will not be drawn.
101  | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
102  | int wn_update()
103  | {
104  |   WINDOW *w;
105  | 
106  |   wn_log("wn_update() START **** \n");
107  |   wn_log_indent(+2);
108  | 
109  |   /*-------------------------------
110  |     Save window currently active
111  |   -------------------------------*/
112  |   if (top_window)
113  |     wn_save(top_window);
114  | 
115  |   /*---------------------------------------------
116  |     Fill virtual screen with desktop attribute if
117  |     no desktop saved
118  |   ---------------------------------------------*/
119  |   /*
120  |   if (!wn_desktop(1))
121  |     v_fillarea(0,0,_cursvar.cols,_cursvar.lines,' ',_desktop_att);
122  |   */
123  |   clrscr();
124  | 
125  |   /*------------------------------------
126  |     Draw all windows on virtual screen
127  |   -------------------------------------*/
128  |   if (start_window != NULL) {
129  |     w = start_window;
130  |     while (w) {
131  |       if (! (w->flag & HIDDEN))     /* Restore window if not hidden */
132  |         wn_restore(w);
133  |       w = w->next;
134  |     }
135  |   }
136  | 
137  |   wn_log_indent(-2);
138  |   wn_log("wn_update() END ****\n");
139  | 
140  |   /*---------------------
141  |     Return all OK flag
142  |   ----------------------*/
143  |   return(TRUE);
144  | }
145  | 
146  | 
147  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
148  |    FUNCTION: wn_dmode()
149  |     PURPOSE: Set window display mode (PAINT or FLASH)
150  | DESCRIPTION: This a dummy for compatibility with WindowBoss
151  |     RETURNS: nothing
152  |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
153  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
154  | void wn_dmode(int mode)
155  | {
156  |   mode++;
157  | }
158  | 
159  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
160  |    FUNCTION: wn_save()
161  |     PURPOSE: Save a window, including the border (if any)
162  |      SYNTAX: WINDOW *wn_save(WINDOWPTR w);
163  | DESCRIPTION: If no space was allocated, this function will allocate
164  |              memory to save the window. If space was allocated, we
165  |              assume that the size of the window has not been changed.
166  |     RETURNS: nothing
167  |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
168  |              920106 V0.2 - Now also saves the border (if any)
169  |              920916 V0.3 - Now also saves the area for the shadow effect
170  |              931011 V0.4 - Now call v_gettext (origin 0,0)
171  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
172  | WINDOW *wn_save(WINDOWPTR w)
173  | {
174  |   int row,col;
175  | 
176  |   if (!w)              /* Check if window opened */
177  |     return(NULL);
178  |   wn_log("wn_save(%p,%s) (%d,%d)-(%d,%d) \n",w,w->title,w->wx1,w->wy1,w->wx2,w->wy2);
179  | 
180  |   /*---------------------------------------
181  |     Allocate memory for saving window
182  |     (inclusive border and shadow)
183  |   ---------------------------------------*/
184  |   if (!w->scrnsave) {
185  |     w->scrnsave = (char *) calloc((w->xsize)*(w->ysize)*2,1);
186  |     if (!w->scrnsave) {
187  |       fprintf(stderr,"Not enough memory to save window\n");
188  |       exit(1);
189  |     }
190  |   }
191  | 
192  |   /*---------------------------------------
193  |     Save contents of the window
194  |   ---------------------------------------*/
195  |   v_gettext(w->wx1,w->wy1,w->wx2,w->wy2,w->scrnsave);
196  | 
197  |   /*-------------------------------
198  |     Save cursor info of the window
199  |   ---------------------------------*/
200  |   v_getcurpos(&row,&col);
201  |   w->ccy = row;
202  |   w->ccx = col;
203  | 
204  |   return(w);        /* Return pointer to last saved window */
205  | 
206  | }
207  | 
208  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
209  |    FUNCTION: wn_hide()
210  |     PURPOSE: Hide a window
211  |      SYNTAX: int wn_hide(WINDOWPTR w);
212  | DESCRIPTION: Hide a window by settting the window flag to HIDDEN and
213  |              update the complete screen. Hidden windows will not be drawn
214  |     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW if window 'w' not opened.
215  |              TRUE if all OK.
216  |     HISTORY: 920130 V0.1 - Initial version
217  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
218  | int wn_hide(WINDOWPTR w)
219  | {
220  |   wn_log("wn_hide(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
221  | 
222  |   if (!w)                   /* Check if window opened */
223  |     return(NO_WINDOW);
224  |   w->flag = TRUE;           /* Set hidden flag        */
225  |   wn_update();              /* Update all windows     */
226  |   return(TRUE);
227  | }
228  | 
229  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
230  |    FUNCTION: wn_unhide()
231  |     PURPOSE: Unhide a window
232  |      SYNTAX: int wn_unhide(WINDOWPTR w);
233  | DESCRIPTION: Unhide a window by resettting the hideflag
234  |              update the complete screen.
235  |     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW if window 'w' not opened.
236  |              TRUE if all OK.
237  |     HISTORY: 920130 V0.1 - Initial version
238  |              931021 V0.2 - Now uses w->hideflag (was w->flag)
239  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
240  | int wn_unhide(WINDOWPTR w)
241  | {
242  |   wn_log("wn_unhide(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
243  | 
244  |   if (!w)                       /* Check if window opened */
245  |     return(NO_WINDOW);
246  |   w->hideflag = 0;              /* Reset hidden flag */
247  |   wn_update();                  /* Update all windows */
248  |   return(TRUE);
249  | }
250  | 
251  | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
252  |     FUNCTION: wn_move()
253  |      PURPOSE: Move a window on the screen
254  |       SYNTAX: int wn_move(WINDOW *w , int row, int col);
255  |  DESCRIPTION: Move window 'w' to 'row' and 'col'
256  |      RETURNS: NO_WINDOW if window 'w' not opened.
257  |               TRUE if all OK.
258  |      HISTORY: 920920 V0.1 - Initial version
259  | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
260  | int wn_move(WINDOW *w , int row, int col)
261  | {
262  |   int dx = 0;
263  |   int dy = 0;
264  | 
265  |   wn_log("wn_move(%p,%s,%2d,%2d)\n",w,w->title,row,col);
266  |   wn_log_indent(+2);
267  | 
268  |   /*--------------------------
269  |     Check if window opened
270  |   --------------------------*/
271  |   if (!w)
272  |     return(NO_WINDOW);
273  | 
274  |   /*--------------------------
275  |     Check parameters
276  |   --------------------------*/
277  |   row = minmax(0,row,_cursvar.lines);
278  |   col = minmax(0,col,_cursvar.cols);
279  | 
280  |   /*----------------------------------------------
281  |     Calculate in which direction we have to move
282  |   -----------------------------------------------*/
283  |   if (row > w->wy1) dy=1; else dy=-1 ;
284  |   if (col > w->wx1) dx=1; else dx=-1 ;
285  | 
286  |   /*---------------------------------
287  |     Move the window over the screen
288  |   -----------------------------------*/
289  |   do {
290  |     /* Update column pointers */
291  |     if (((dx>0 && w->wx2<_cursvar.cols) || (dx<0 && w->wx1 > 0)) && w->wx1 != col) {
292  |       w->wx1 += dx;
293  |       w->wx2 += dx;
294  |       w->x1  += dx;
295  |       w->x2  += dx;
296  |     }
297  |     /* Update row pointers */
298  |     if (((dy>0 && w->wy2 < _cursvar.lines) || (dy<0 && w->wy1 > 0)) && w->wy1 != row) {
299  |       w->wy1 += dy;
300  |       w->wy2 += dy;
301  |       w->y1  += dy;
302  |       w->y2  += dy;
303  |     }
304  |     wn_restore(w);
305  |     wn_update();
306  |     wn_log("target row=%2d, target col=%2d\n",row,col);
307  |     wn_log("moved to (%02d,%02d)\n",w->wx1, w->wy1);
308  |   }
309  |   while ((w->wx1 != col) || (w->wy1 != row));
310  | 
311  |   wn_log_indent(-2);
312  |   wn_log("end of wn_move()\n");
313  | 
314  |   return(0);
315  | 
316  | }
317  | 
318  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
319  |    FUNCTION: wn_restore()
320  |     PURPOSE: Restore window border, contents and cursor on the screen.
321  |      SYNTAX: void wn_restore(WINDOWPTR w);
322  | DESCRIPTION: -
323  |     RETURNS: nothing
324  |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
325  | 
326  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
327  | void wn_restore(WINDOWPTR w)
328  | {
329  | 
330  |   wn_log("wn_restore(%p,%s) (%d,%d)-(%d,%d)\n",w,w->title,w->wx1,w->wy1,w->wx2,w->wy2);
331  | 
332  |   if (!w)             /* Check if window opened */
333  |     return;
334  |   if (w->hideflag)    /* Check if window not hidden */
335  |     return;
336  | 
337  |   if (w->scrnsave)    /* Restore contents of window */
338  |     v_puttext(w->wx1,w->wy1,w->wx2,w->wy2,w->scrnsave);
339  | 
340  |   wn_fixcsr(w);     /* Initialize cursor */
341  | 
342  | }
343  | 
344  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
345  |    FUNCTION: wn_top()
346  |     PURPOSE: Make a window the top window
347  |      SYNTAX: int wn_top(WINDOW *w);
348  | DESCRIPTION: Make window 'w' the top window by:
349  |              Transfering it to the end of the list of windows
350  |              Saving the contents of the current top window
351  |              Restoring the contents of window 'w'
352  |     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW: window not opened
353  |              TRUE     : all ok
354  |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1
355  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
356  | int wn_top(WINDOW *w)
357  | {
358  |   if (!w)                    /* Check if the window is opened */
359  |     return(NO_WINDOW);
360  |   wn_log("wn_top(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
361  | 
362  |   if (w != last_window) {    /* If the window is not the last window */
363  |     del_wn_list(w);          /* Of the double linked list, put it in */
364  |     add_wn_list(w);          /* the last position */
365  |   }
366  | 
367  |   if (w == top_window)       /* Check if window not already top window */
368  |     wn_fixcsr(w);
369  |   else
370  |   {
371  |     if (top_window != NULL)
372  |       wn_save(top_window);   /* Save contents of active window */
373  |     top_window = w;          /* Set pointer to top window */
374  |     wn_restore(w);           /* Restore contents of new active window */
375  |   }
376  | 
377  |   return(TRUE);
378  | }
379  | 
380  | 
381  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
382  |    FUNCTION: wn_dma()
383  |     PURPOSE: Write flag (TRUE or FALSE) to video RAM
384  |      SYNTAX: void wn_dma(int flag);
385  | DESCRIPTION: Dummy function to be compatible with WindowBoss
386  |     RETURNS: nothing
387  |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Intitial version
388  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
389  | void wn_dma(int flag)
390  | {
391  |   flag++;
392  | }
393  | 
394  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
395  |    FUNCTION: wn_sync()
396  |     PURPOSE: set/clear window's cursor synchronisation flag
397  |      SYNTAX: wn_sync(WINDOW *w, int flag);
398  | DESCRIPTION: If flag is TRUE, subsequent text output will be
399  |              followed by a flashing (normal) cursor. If FALSE
400  |              the cursor will not be physically advanced
401  |     RETURNS: A copy of the flag
402  |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
403  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
404  | int wn_sync(WINDOW *w, int flag)
405  | {
406  |   /*------------------------
407  |     Check if window opened
408  |   --------------------------*/
409  |   if (!w)
410  |     return(NO_WINDOW);
411  | 
412  |   w->synflg = flag;
413  |   return(flag);
414  | }
415  | 
416  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
417  |    FUNCTION: wn_fixcsr()
418  |     PURPOSE: Update window's cursor position
419  |      SYNTAX: int wn_fixcsr(WINDOW *w);
420  | DESCRIPTION: Place the physical cursor at the logical window cursor
421  |              position. Does not alter the state of window's syncflag.
422  |              Is mostly used after a wn_sync() to disable the cursor.
423  |     RETURNS: TRUE, or FALSE if error
424  |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
425  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
426  | int wn_fixcsr(WINDOW *w)
427  | {
428  |   /*------------------------
429  |     Check if window opened
430  |   --------------------------*/
431  |   if (!w)
432  |     return(NO_WINDOW);
433  | 
434  |   /*--------------------------------
435  |     Check if this is the top window
436  |   ----------------------------------*/
437  |   if (w != top_window)
438  |     return(NO_WINDOW);
439  | 
440  |   /*--------------------------------------
441  |     Get physical cursor coordinates and
442  |     show cursor (if wanted
443  |   --------------------------------------*/
444  |   v_setcurpos(w->ccy,w->ccx);
445  |   if (w->synflg)
446  |     v_cursoron();
447  |   else
448  |     v_cursoroff();
449  | 
450  |   return(TRUE);
451  | }
452  | 
453  | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
454  |     FUNCTION: wn_fill()
455  |      PURPOSE: Fill part of a opened window with character and attribute
456  |       SYNTAX: void wn_fill(WINDOW *w, int row, int col, int width, int height,
457  |               int c, int att);
458  |  DESCRIPTION:
459  |      RETURNS: Nothing
460  |      HISTORY: 14-Oct-1993 V0.1
461  | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
462  | void wn_fill(WINDOW *w, int row, int col, int width, int height, int c, int att)
463  | {
464  |   v_fillarea(w->y1+row,w->x1+col,width,height,c,att);
465  | }
466  | 
467  | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
468  |     FUNCTION: wn_setattrib()
469  |      PURPOSE: Set attribute of a field within a window
470  |       SYNTAX: void wn_setattrib(WINDOW *w, int row1, int col1, int xsize,int ysize, int att);
471  |  DESCRIPTION: -
472  |      RETURNS: Nothing
473  |      HISTORY: 14-Oct-1993 V0.1
474  | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
475  | void wn_setattrib(WINDOW *w, int row1, int col1, int xsize,int ysize, int att)
476  | {
477  |   v_setattrib_area(w->y1+row1, w->x1+col1, xsize, ysize, att);
478  | }
479  | 
480  | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
481  |     FUNCTION: wn_setone()
482  |      PURPOSE: Set attribute of 1 character in a window
483  |       SYNTAX: int wn_setone(WINDOW *w, int row, int col, int attrib);
484  |               WINDOW *w : pointer to window to perform action on
485  |               int row   : row (y) of position to set
486  |               int col   : col (x) of position to set
487  |               int attrib: attribute to set on (row,col) in window 'w'
488  |  DESCRIPTION: -
489  |      RETURNS: 0         if all OK
490  |               NO_WINDOW if window not opened
491  |      HISTORY: 920926 V0.1
492  | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
493  | int wn_setone(WINDOW *w, int row, int col, int attrib)
494  | {
495  |   /*----------------------------------
496  |     Check if window opened and topped
497  |   -----------------------------------*/
498  |   if (!w)
499  |     return(NO_WINDOW);
500  | 
501  |   /*---------------------------
502  |     Call the routine setone()
503  |   ----------------------------*/
504  |   v_setattrib(w->y1+row,w->x1+col,attrib);
505  |   return(0);
506  | }
507  | 
508  | 
509  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
510  |    FUNCTION: wn_nattrib()
511  |     PURPOSE: Set and change window attribute
512  |      SYNTAX: int wn_nattrib(WINDOW *w, int wattrib);
513  | DESCRIPTION: The attribute of window 'w'is changed immediately.
514  |              The border will not be altered.
515  |     RETURNS: NO_WINDOW if no window opened.
516  |              TRUE if all ok.
517  |     HISTORY: 910907 V0.1 - Initial version
518  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
519  | int wn_nattrib(WINDOW *w, int wcolor)
520  | {
521  |   /*----------------------------------
522  |     Check if window opened and topped
523  |   -----------------------------------*/
524  |   if (!w)
525  |     return(NO_WINDOW);
526  |   if (w != top_window)
527  |     wn_top(w);
528  | 
529  |   w->wcolor = wcolor;     /* Save attribute */
530  |   v_setattrib_area(w->y1, w->x1, w->xsize, w->ysize, wcolor);
531  |   return(TRUE);
532  | }
533  | 
534  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
535  |     FUNCTION: add_wn_list()
536  |      PURPOSE: Add window to double linked list
537  |       SYNTAX: WINDOw *add_wn_list(WINDOW *w);
538  |  DESCRIPTION: -
539  |      RETURNS: pointer to window at start of list
540  |      HISTORY: 910730 V0.1 - Initial version
541  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
542  | static WINDOW *add_wn_list(WINDOW *w)
543  | {
544  |   WINDOW *tmp_w;
545  | 
546  |   wn_log("add_wn_list(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
547  | 
548  |   /*-----------------------
549  |     Check if window opened
550  |   -------------------------*/
551  |   if (!w)
552  |     return(NULL);
553  | 
554  |   /*-----------------------------------
555  |     Add window to double linked list
556  |   ------------------------------------*/
557  |   if (start_window == NULL)
558  |   {
559  |     /*--- This is the first window in the list ---*/
560  |     last_window  = w;
561  |     start_window = w;
562  |     w->next   = NULL;
563  |     w->prev   = NULL;
564  |   }
565  |   else
566  |   {
567  |     /*--- Add this window to end of the list ---*/
568  |     last_window->next = w;
569  |     w->next  = NULL;
570  |     w->prev  = last_window;
571  |     last_window = w;
572  |   }
573  | 
574  |   tmp_w = start_window;
575  |   while(tmp_w)
576  |     tmp_w = tmp_w->next;
577  | 
578  |   return(start_window);
579  | }
580  | 
581  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
582  |     FUNCTION: del_wn_list()
583  |      PURPOSE: delete window control block from double linked list
584  |       SYNTAX: WINDOW *del_wn_list(WINDOW *w);
585  |  DESCRIPTION: -
586  |      RETURNS: pointer to start of list
587  |      HISTORY: 910730 V0.1 - Initial version
588  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
589  | static WINDOW *del_wn_list(WINDOW *w)
590  | {
591  |   wn_log("del_wn_list(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
592  | 
593  |   /*------------------------
594  |     Check if window opened
595  |   --------------------------*/
596  |   if (!w)
597  |     return(NULL);
598  | 
599  |   if (w == start_window)
600  |   {
601  |     /*--- We are going to delete the first window in the
602  |           double linked list ---*/
603  |     start_window = start_window->next;
604  |     if (start_window)
605  |       start_window->prev = NULL;
606  |     if (!start_window)   /* If no window opened any more ... */
607  |       last_window = NULL;
608  |   }
609  |   else {
610  |     /*--- We are going to delete a window in the middle or at the
611  |           end of the double linked list ---*/
612  |     if (!w->next) {
613  |       /*--- This window is the last one of the list ---*/
614  |       last_window = w->prev;
615  |       w->prev->next = NULL;
616  |     }
617  |     else {
618  |       /*--- This window is in the middle of the list ---*/
619  |       w->prev->next = w->next;
620  |       w->next->prev = w->prev;
621  |     }
622  |   }
623  | 
624  |   level_wnds(start_window);
625  |   return(start_window);
626  | }
627  | 
628  | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
629  |     FUNCTION: level_windows()
630  |      PURPOSE: This funtion runs thru the list from the beginning and
631  |               reassignes level values to each window after and inser-
632  |               tion or deletion.
633  |       SYNTAX: static void level_wnds(WINDOW *startw);
634  |  DESCRIPTION:
635  |      RETURNS: nothing
636  |      HISTORY: 21-Oct-1993 V0.1
637  | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
638  | static void level_wnds(WINDOW *startw)
639  | {
640  |   int  i = 1;
641  |   WINDOW *w;
642  | 
643  |   w = startw;
644  |   while (w) {               /* While window pointer not NULL */
645  |     w->level = i++;         /* Assign a new level number */
646  |     wn_log("  --- %p (%s) level:%2d\n",w,w->title,w->level);
647  |     w = w->next;            /* Get next window */
648  |   }
649  | }
650  | 
651  | 
652  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
653  |    FUNCTION: wn_open()
654  |     PURPOSE: open and use a new text window. Origin is (0,0)
655  |      SYNTAX: WINDOW *wn_open(int btype, int row, int col, int xsize,
656  |                              int ysize, int wcolor, int bcolor);
657  | DESCRIPTION: btype   = border type (_NO_BORDER,_SINGLE_LINE,_DOUBLE_LINE).
658  |              row     = top left row of window
659  |              col     = top left column of window
660  |              xsize   = width of contents of window  (inclusive border)
661  |              ysize   = height of contents of window (inclusive border)
662  |              wcolor  = color of window contents
663  |              bcolor  = color of border
664  |     RETURNS: Pointer to the window control block of opened window
665  |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
666  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
667  | WINDOW *wn_open( int btype,         /* Window type      */
668  |                  int row,           /* Top left row     */
669  |                  int col,           /* Top left corner  */
670  |                  int xsize,         /* External width   */
671  |                  int ysize,         /* External height  */
672  |                  int wcolor,        /* Window attribute */
673  |                  int bcolor)        /* Border attribute */
674  | {
675  |   WINDOWPTR w;
676  | 
677  |   /*----------------------------------
678  |     Reserve memory for the window
679  |   -----------------------------------*/
680  |   w = (WINDOWPTR) calloc(sizeof(WINDOW),1);
681  |   if (!w) {
682  |     fprintf(stderr,"Not enough memory to open window\n");
683  |     exit(1);
684  |   }
685  | 
686  |   wn_log("wn_open() %p: (%2d,%2d) w=%2d h=%2d\n",w,row,col,xsize,ysize);
687  | 
688  |   /*------------------
689  |     Check parameters
690  |   -------------------*/
691  |   if (btype == _NO_BORDER) {
692  |     wn_log("wn_open(1) NO_BORDER\n");
693  |     /*---------------------------------------
694  |       Window has no border
695  |     ---------------------------------------*/
696  |     ysize  = minmax(0,ysize,_cursvar.lines);
697  |     xsize  = minmax(0,xsize,_cursvar.cols);
698  | 	wn_log("wn_open(2) xsize = %d   ysize = %d\n",xsize,ysize);
699  | 
700  |     row = minmax(0,row,_cursvar.lines);
701  |     col = minmax(0,col,_cursvar.cols);
702  | 	wn_log("wn_open(3) row = %d   col = %d\n",row,col);
703  | 
704  |     if (row+ysize > _cursvar.lines)
705  |       ysize = _cursvar.lines-row;
706  |     if (col+xsize > _cursvar.cols)
707  |       xsize = _cursvar.cols-col;
708  | 	wn_log("wn_open(4) xsize = %d   ysize = %d\n",xsize,ysize);
709  |   }
710  |   else {
711  | 
712  |     wn_log("wn_open() WITH BORDER");
713  |     /*---------------------------------------
714  |       Window has a border
715  |     ---------------------------------------*/
716  |     ysize  = minmax(0,ysize,_cursvar.lines);
717  |     xsize  = minmax(0,xsize,_cursvar.cols);
718  | 	wn_log("wn_open() xsize = %d   ysize = %d\n",xsize,ysize);
719  | 
720  |     row = minmax(0,row,_cursvar.lines-4);
721  |     col = minmax(0,col,_cursvar.cols-4);
722  | 	wn_log("wn_open() row = %d   col = %d\n",row,col);
723  | 
724  |     if (row+ysize > _cursvar.lines-2)
725  |       ysize  = (_cursvar.lines-row);
726  |     if (col+xsize > _cursvar.cols-2)
727  |       xsize = _cursvar.cols-col;
728  | 	wn_log("wn_open() xsize = %d   ysize = %d\n",xsize,ysize);
729  |   }
730  | 
731  |   /*---------------------------------------
732  |     Save coordinates of complete window
733  |   ---------------------------------------*/
734  |   w->wx1 = col;
735  |   w->wy1 = row;
736  |   w->wx2 = w->wx1 + xsize - 1;
737  |   w->wy2 = w->wy1 + ysize - 1;
738  | 
739  |   /*---------------------------------------
740  |     Save coordinates of 'text' window
741  |   ---------------------------------------*/
742  |   if (btype == _NO_BORDER) {
743  |     w->x1 = w->wx1;
744  |     w->y1 = w->wy1;
745  |     w->x2 = w->wx2;
746  |     w->y2 = w->wy2;
747  |   }
748  |   else {   /* Window has a border */
749  |     w->x1 = w->wx1 + 1;
750  |     w->y1 = w->wy1 + 1;
751  |     w->x2 = w->wx2 - 1;
752  |     w->y2 = w->wy2 - 1;
753  |   }
754  | 
755  |   wn_log("wn_open(5) (%d,%d) x2 = %d  y2=%d\n",w->x1,w->y1,w->x2,w->y2);
756  | 
757  |   /*-----------------------------------
758  |     Save variables in window structure
759  |   -------------------------------------*/
760  |   w->btype     = btype;           /* Border type         */
761  |   w->xsize     = xsize;
762  |   w->ysize     = ysize;
763  |   w->wcolor    = wcolor;
764  |   w->bcolor    = bcolor;
765  |   w->ccy       = row;            /* Initialize screen cursor row  */
766  |   w->ccx       = col;            /* Initialize screen cursor col  */
767  |   w->synflg    = FALSE;          /* Standard cursor off           */
768  |   w->scroll_ok = TRUE;           /* Standard scrolling window     */
769  |   w->scrnsave  = NULL;
770  |   w->monitor   = monitor;
771  |   w->title     = NULL;
772  |   w->page      = 0;
773  | 
774  |   wn_log("Variables are initialized\n");
775  | 
776  |   /*---------------------------------------
777  |     Save contents of current active window
778  |     Add window to double linked list
779  |   --------------------------------------*/
780  |   if (top_window != NULL) {
781  |     wn_save(top_window);
782  |   }
783  |   add_wn_list(w);
784  |   top_window = w;
785  | 
786  |   /*--------------------------------
787  |     Draw window border (if wanted)
788  |   --------------------------------*/
789  |   if (btype != _NO_BORDER)
790  |   {
791  |     wn_border(w,btype);
792  |   }
793  |   /*-----------------------
794  |     Add the shadow effect
795  |   ------------------------*/
796  |   if ( btype != _NO_BORDER && shadow != FALSE)
797  |     wn_shadow(w);
798  | 
799  |   /*------------------------------
800  |     Clear the inside of the window
801  |   --------------------------------*/
802  |   wn_clear(w);
803  | 
804  |   return(w);
805  | }
806  | 
807  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
808  |    FUNCTION: wn_close()
809  |     PURPOSE: close a window
810  |      SYNTAX: WINDOW *wn_close(WINDOW *w);
811  | DESCRIPTION: Checks if window defined,
812  |              Deletes it from the linked window list
813  |              Free's the memory allocated to it.
814  |              Makes the last window in the linked list the top window
815  |              Updates the screen.
816  |     RETURNS: Alway's returns NULL pointer
817  |     HISTORY: 910709 V0.1 - Initial version
818  |              920919 V0.2 - If the window closed was the top window,
819  |                            a NULL pointer will be assigned to 'top_window'
820  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
821  | WINDOW *wn_close(WINDOW *w)
822  | {
823  | 
824  |   wn_log("wn_close(%p,%s)\n",w,w->title);
825  | 
826  |   /*---------------------------
827  |     Check if window was opened
828  |   -----------------------------*/
829  |   if (w) {
830  | 
831  |     /*-------------------------------------------
832  |       Check if window to close is the top window
833  |     ---------------------------------------------*/
834  |     if (w == top_window) {
835  |       top_window = NULL;
836  |       last_window = NULL;
837  |     }
838  | 
839  |     /*-----------------------------------------------
840  |       Delete the window from the double linked list
841  |       and free memory of window's save area and
842  |       control block
843  |     -------------------------------------------------*/
844  |     del_wn_list(w);
845  |     if (w->scrnsave)
846  |       free(w->scrnsave);
847  |     if (w->title)
848  |       free(w->title);
849  |     free((char *) w);
850  | 
851  |     /*-----------------------------------------------
852  |       Make last window in linked list the top window
853  |       and update the screen
854  |     -------------------------------------------------*/
855  |     wn_top(last_window);
856  |     wn_update();
857  |   }
858  | 
859  |   return(NULL);
860  | }
861  | 
862  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
863  |     FUNCTION: wn_init()
864  |      PURPOSE: initialize window and video enviroment
865  |       SYNTAX: void wn_init(void);
866  |  DESCRIPTION: Sets atexit() pointer.
867  |               Initializes global variables _NormAttr, _TextAttr, _LastMode,
868  |               _CurCrtSize, _CheckSnow, _DirectVideo, _WindMin and _WindMax.
869  |               by calling the assembler function crtinit().
870  |               Sets the segmentaddress 'displayseg' of the physical videoscreen.
871  |               Gets the current cursor size and position and saves the contents
872  |               of the current screen and clears it
873  |      RETURNS: nothing
874  |      HISTORY: 910710 V0.2 - Adjusted for window enviroment
875  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
876  | void wn_init()
877  | {
878  |   /*------------------
879  |     Initializations
880  |   ------------------*/
881  |   wn_log("wn_init()\n");
882  |   atexit(wn_exit);
883  | 
884  |   /*-----------------------------------------------------------------
885  |      Initializes global variables _NormAttr, _TextAttr, _LastMode,
886  |      _CurCrtSize, _CheckSnow, _DirectVideo, _WindMin and _WindMax.
887  |   -----------------------------------------------------------------*/
888  |   initscr();
889  | 
890  | #if defined(USE_FORTIFY)
891  |   Fortify_ListAllMemory();
892  |   // Fortify_OutputStatistics();
893  | #endif
894  | 
895  |   /*-----------------------------
896  |     Get original cursor position
897  |   --------------------------------*/
898  |   v_getcurpos(&startrow,&startcol);
899  |   v_cursoroff();
900  | 
901  |   set_display_colors(COLOR);
902  | 
903  |   /*---------------------
904  |     Open the top window
905  |   ----------------------*/
906  |   start_screen = v_savescreen(_cursvar.cols,_cursvar.lines);
907  | 
908  | #if defined(USE_FORTIFY)
909  |   Fortify_ListAllMemory();
910  |   // Fortify_OutputStatistics();
911  | #endif
912  | 
913  |   clrscr();
914  | 
915  | }
916  | 
917  | /*#+func-------------------------------------------------------------------
918  |     FUNCTION: wn_exit()
919  |      PURPOSE: Exit from window enviroment
920  |       SYNTAX: void wn_exit(void);
921  |  DESCRIPTION: Calls several routines to clean up the HvA window enviroment.
922  |               Closes all open windows.
923  |               Restores the screen which was there when starting the window
924  |               enviroment, restores the cursor position and shows it.
925  |               Close the logfile 'window.log' (if opened).
926  |      RETURNS: nothing
927  |      HISTORY: 910717 V0.1 - Initial version
928  |               920107 V0.1 - The functions will be performed only once
929  | --#-func-------------------------------------------------------------------*/
930  | void wn_exit()
931  | {
932  |   static int done = FALSE;
933  | 
934  |   if (!done)               /* Do this only once */
935  |   {
936  |     wn_log("wn_exit()\n");
937  | 
938  |     exit_help();
939  |     exit_pulldown();
940  |     exit_funkey();
941  |     wn_closeall();
942  |     if (start_screen)
943  |       start_screen = v_restorescreen(start_screen);
944  |     v_setcurpos(startrow,startcol);
945  |     v_cursoron();
946  | 
947  |     done = TRUE;        /* Set flag (this routine has been executed */
948  |   }
949  | }
950  | 
951  | /*#+func-----------------------------------------------------------------------
952  |     FUNCTION: wnd_overlap()
953  |      PURPOSE: Determines if two windows overlap the each other
954  |       SYNTAX: int wn_overlap(WINDOW *w1, WINDOW *w2);
955  |  DESCRIPTION:
956  |      RETURNS: FALSE if no overlap, TRUE if there is an overlap
957  |      HISTORY: 21-Oct-1993 V0.1
958  | --#-func----------------------------------------------------------------------*/
959  | int wn_overlap(WINDOW *w1, WINDOW *w2)
960  | {
961  |   if (w1->page != w2->page)          /* If not in same page */
962  |      return(FALSE);                  /* they can't overlap  */
963  | 
964  |   if (((w2->x1 >= w1->x1) && (w2->x1 <= w1->x2)) &&
965  |      (((w2->y1 >= w1->y1) && (w2->y1 <= w1->y2)) ||
966  |       ((w2->y2 >= w1->y1) && (w2->y2 <= w1->y2))))
967  |           return(TRUE);
968  | 
969  |   if (((w2->x2 >= w1->x1) && (w2->x2 <= w1->x2)) &&
970  |      (((w2->y1 >= w1->y1) && (w2->y1 <= w1->y2)) ||
971  |       ((w2->y2 >= w1->y1) && (w2->y2 <= w1->y2))))
972  |           return(TRUE);
973  | 
974  |   if (((w1->x1 >= w2->x1) && (w1->x2 <= w2->x2)) &&
975  |      (((w1->y1 >= w2->y1) && (w1->y1 <= w2->y2)) ||
976  |       ((w1->y2 >= w2->y1) && (w1->y2 <= w2->y2))))
977  |           return(TRUE);
978  | 
979  |   if (((w1->y1 >= w2->y1) && (w1->y2 <= w2->y2)) &&
980  |      (((w1->x1 >= w2->x1) && (w1->x1 <= w2->x2)) ||
981  |       ((w1->x2 >= w2->x1) && (w1->x2 <= w2->x2))))
982  |           return(TRUE);
983  | 
984  |   if ((w1->x1 > w2->x1 && w1->x2 < w2->x2) &&
985  |       (w1->y1 > w2->y1 && w1->y2 < w2->y2))
986  |           return(TRUE);
987  | 
988  |   return(FALSE);
989  | }
990  |
